review: The ramen at this place is hands down the best I‚Äôve ever tasted! The staff, especially Vidusha, are incredibly friendly and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Can‚Äôt wait to come back for more!

Ate here a few times as we enjoyed it so much. I recommend an outside table on the balcony. It‚Äôs a peaceful scene away from the bustle of Galle Fort. The large prawns are amazing. Definitely recommend them. Pasta bolognaise was also delicious as was...the Singapore spiced prawns.
Friendly service. Definitely a restaurant to visit when in Galle Fo the Singapore spiced prawns.
Friendly service. Definitely a restaurant to visit when in Galle Fort.
Delicious food ate here two nights, excellent service. Hummus, spring rolls, fish in banana, tuna, lovely bottle of wine all excellent

Upstairs at the Dutch Hospital 
you'll find great coffee, good service & all with a view. Lovely breeze too on a hot day!!!

Food was yummy and we enjoyed the time we spent at Starbeans. 
And Chamodh did a good job and supported to select our lunch dishes for our preferences.
Everything was amazing. Great Food, Great drinks and the Service man widuja was extremly friendly. Also fair Price , we will come again!!
The ramen was amazing and so flavourful and the service was great. Our waiter Chamod and the rest of the staff are all so friendly. Would highly recommend.
Very delicious fresh food, big portions üëçüèΩ and nice view from the terrace. Good and fast service. Highly recommended place to relax during the trip

Good place, live music, big and delicious portions, friendly waiters
Thanks Vidusha for good service
Highly recommended
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Overlooking the beautiful bay. Many thanks to Manjula for his service and local knowledge.

Maybe the worst version of Pad Thai I have ever had. Wanted to sit on patio with ocean view but couldnt as tourists had to smoke cigarettes. Annoyed by staff chatter inside restaurant. Should have gone somewhere else.

Great food, exceptional crab, delightful music.
All staff helpful. View loverly. Prawn and mango salad yummy.
Please go

Good service at this restaurant, particularly from Manjula who with his colleague ensured we had an enjoyable evening. Extensive menu, catering for all tastes. Good location in the Old Dutch Hospital, get a table on the veranda overlooking the sea and catch the evening sea...bre breeze
Excelent food, nice atmosphere. We should recommend. After two weeks on SriLanka we met here very good international food focus especially for family‚Äôs.
This restaurant overlooks the ocean it has a varied menu and the food was delicious the service was attentive but not intrusive and we thoroughly enjoyed the evening
Staff polite and friendly service. The menu had a good variety of dishes. Our meal was well proportioned and tasted delicious. This was a return visit and recommend it to others.
Really great food, we had the calamari and the fresh whole fish with sri lankin curry sauce, portions are very generous.

Our meal did not match the prices on the menu. Having selected a fish we were told it was a higher price. We waited almost an hour for our meal. While the staff were pleasant the restaurant was overpriced for a pretty average meal.
Delightful sea food and excellent service üòç Highly recommend the seafood marinara and the seafood platter looked incredible.

This is a lovely little restaurant with amazing food and attentive service. 
We would definitely return if we‚Äôre lucky enough to ever be in Galle Fort again.

Traditional Sri lankan cuisine at its best. Great sea food. The owner with geinuine passion and pride of cooking. One of the best meals we had on the island. We visited the restaurant a few times and can't wait to go there again

Nice friendly restaurant with good service and reasonable prices.

We shared the spicy crab (what a glorious mess you can get into tackling this dish!) and the fresh tuna. Both dishes were beautiful.

Don‚Äôt trust the reviews!

We just had dinner here and the food was awful. We waited over an hour and they got our order wrong. All the reviews on here are by fake profiles with one contribution. Don‚Äôt get scammed

The food is amazing. Yellow crab curry and devilled prawns. Great way to end a tour of Sri Lanka. 

The service?‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Well luckily the food is beyond 5 stars to make up for it.

If you have brown skin, PLEASE do yourself a favor and DON'T visit this place. Me and my parents were HORRIBLY humiliated here and subject to the worst form of racism where the staff refused to even seat us. Why? Because the staff only seems...to want to entertain white customers! 
We entered the cafe and asked to be seated at a table for 3. A very disgruntled male waiter then went on to point us to a table for 2.  I told him for the second time that we were 3. Again, he pointed me towards a table for 2. Since the cafe was empty and had less than 2 occupied tables, I then pulled up a chair from the table next to ours to help my Dad sit down (my dad had a cast on his leg and was walking with a walking stick).
The second I pulled up the chair, the same waiter practically pushed me out with more hostility than I've ever experienced in my life, asking me in a very loud /raised voice to wait to be seated. (wait for the empty place to get emptier?). He then went on to pick up the chair and bang it on the floor! This too when my Dad was visibly injured. RIDICULOUS.
I'm horrified by how rude this server was....Completely ruined our nig to want to entertain white customers!

had great time at bastille.  all there seafood dishes are top noch
this  the  best  restaurant  we tried in sri lanka
Best dishes in the country, spicy crab in chille Saudi is the one of the best dish they have .god price and taste .
Number one seafood restaurant with out question, you gonna love this place after you ate , staff is super friendly
I love this  plce. If you are looking for five star food this is the perfect place . Amzing food....
Went for the dinner with my famly , food was absolutely yoummy . Cocktails and drinks also next level.

Excellent ice cream hand made using local produce . 
Staff speak English and are very friendly . The cafe is really clean with cooling fans . Fantastic furniture and beautifully decorated
Lovely icecream and a genuine Sri Lankan family business. We had the coconut flavour which was delicious! The mother and daughter are beautiful and kind, it was a delight to be in their home business

This cafe was a highlight from our time  in Galle. The signature coconut flavoured ice cream was so good we returned and tried other local Sri Lankan flavours like Soursop (also excellent) .  The family who run the business are friendly and welcoming. Overall a...great experie great experience

I went to Galle JUST to try Cafe 82 on the recommendation of other travelers and was not disappointed. I had the "famous" vegan coconut ice cream, and the staff-recommended dairy soursop ice cream. Not only was everything about the experience charming from the formal...furniture inside and the extremely polite staff, but it really was ice cream worth making a trip f furniture inside and the extremely polite staff, but it really was ice cream worth making a trip for.
Some of the best ice cream I've ever had as a vegan! Delicious creamy coconut ice cream served by a beautiful family. It was great to meet Hajiz and chat to him too. Highly recommend it.
I back for more fantastic ice cream.  It was excellent... and it as usual, the service was amazing, I felt like I was coming home.  If you are coming to Galle Fort, do not miss out on a trip here.

This is a beautiful home and the family do food and ice-cream deserts. They are so kind and lovely.Ask them the history of the place it's very interesting.The young man speaks such good English.
The food is freshly cooked and delicious.

This is a really quiet and beautiful place. Had the best vegan soursop ice cream, which didn't taste vegan and was so creamy. 
Could only visit for a short time but hope to go back again.

The only best place to get Homemade Ice cream.
I tried the soursop that was wonderful,the coconut and lemon too was delicious üòã 
I tried the masala chai in the evening.....this is the only best chai you can get

Dont miss this place . Best cofee and best ice cream . Srilanka hospitality by the owners of the place . If you are in Gale or near visit 100% .
Thank you Hirza

A very cosy cafe nestled in lovely streets of Galle.
It is a family owned cafe with most delicious ice creams and some innovative flavours. Highly recommend to visit it and experience an unparalleled and homely hospitality.

Delightful! If you are vegan (and if you are not) this is a must to try place. The combination of friendly staff, tasty vegan waffles, and fresh began ice cream must make for a fantastic experience. Highly recommended.
Finally some soy options! I was absolutely craving an iced coffee and was delighted to find Cafe 82 with numerous vegan options for ice cream and iced coffee (not easy to find in Sri Lanka).
I'm from New Zealand  l had delicious dessert from cafe 82 lm highly recommend caf√© 82 for  any one who is willing to visit.  Friendly environment and best service they offered us l love it.

Excellent place to have variety of ice creams. The place is clean and tidy. The tastes was amazing. Specially i liked the coconut ice cream. One of the best ice creams I have ever had. Highly recommended üëå

Galle is quite expensive, this restaurant was really not cheap compared to everything we had in Sri Lanka. But this we could understand. We took the Kottu veggie and egg which was ok, but already 1450rp. We took the veggie curry and were very disappointed...to see only white rice (very overcooked), dhal and some beans. That was it, nothing more for 1800rp. We used to get rice curry buffet for 1000rp everyhwhere else. Besides need to add 10% charges to the price.
Additionnally the juices were not tasty I guess really average feuits were used. Service quite long, and incredibly hot with no air in the restaurant.

Great Sri Lankan food. Really friendly waiter. Lime Soda was refreshing. Chicken Kottu and Seafood Kottu were delicious!

We went here based on the good reviews and were not dissapointed. It's not a pretentious restaurant, quite the opposite it thrives on its basic down to earth  principle of serving good quality home cooked food at very reasonable prices. The decor and ambiance are...quite basic but the staff are so friendly and full of smiles. As a family restaurant, mum seems to be in charge in the kitchen, busy cooking away and looking through the hatch to check you are satisfied with the meal. We had the seafood and chicken/vegetable curries, which are cooked fresh to order, so they do take a little time to prepare. Both were delicious and great value. (The seafoodcurry comes with rotti so need to order extra which I greedily did.... quite basic but the staff are so friendly and full of smiles. A small and unpretentious restaurant, with mostly indoor tables, serving cheap and tasty Sri Lankan food.  (Galle‚Äôs dining scene is sadly dominated by fancy restaurants serving western food.)  The waiter who looked after me was very engaging.  No alcohol served.

We had dinner here while staying in Galle and the food was amazing. You will not get the frills of some of the nearby restaurants and they do not serve alcohol but you will feel like you have enjoyed an authentic Sri Lankan experience in...this family run establishment. Also warned that the bill will be a lot lower than you expected - we had dinner for two for under ¬£2 this family run establishment. This place should be packed very night on the corner of lighthouse street - it doesn't have an open frontage like so many so its easy to miss. but the food is to die for ! Run by a small family who are absolutely lovely...and so kind and helpful.
I am vegan and their dhal is just the thing of dreams,  only criticism would be a slightly bigger portion. We also had the kottu ? kothu? and that was ssooooo tasty . My friend had chicken noodles which was also very good she said and a big portion too

Amazing food! I recommend to everyone to come and visit this place. The people is very nice and the food is jut delicious!
We had an amazing Kottu and chicken as well as vegetable curry. Both was very delicious! Service was also great! Very nice spot for local food.

Chose this eatery for my daughters 30th birthday as it was so well reviewed on Tripadvisor...and they weren't wrong. We had a superb home cooked authentic Sri Lankan meal, Grandma and Mum in the Kitchen, Dad and son front of house. The room itself is...spartan with about 6 or 7 tables and as everything is freshly prepared you will have to wait 30-40 mins after ordering unless you know the menu and call ahead. We were so impressed that we went there the next night as well with 2 more guests. We ate here based on TripAdvisor reviews and they were not wrong. Absolutely gorgeous food!! Really cosy, home feel to the restaurant, great service by Imal and our curries were cooked based on our spice preferences too. Great portion sizes and really reasonably priced. Would...recommend recommend!!!
Suuuch a good Brinjal Moju! Went during low seaspn so a bit dras but very very good food and friendly staff

According to TripAdvisor there are 148 restaurants/cafe's in Galle Fort, quite daunting but if you are looking for traditional local food then I highly recommend  Imal's, Lighthouse Street. You will find Rohan and his wife Luxmi will give you a warm welcome.As for the food..., it's traditional unusual local dishes cooked by Luxmi in the open front kitchen. Dishes such as 'poll pittu', 'poll rotti', 'kottu' and 'brinjal moju' to name a few. It is like being in their house with mum's home cooking.I visited several times, trying different dishes, all were excellent and good value.The room may be a dark and dingy and there is no outside seating but please do not let that put you off as the welcome and individual service from Rohan makes up.
I am glad I found Imal's I will have found memori , it's traditional unusual local dishes cooked by Luxmi in the open front kitchen. I am glad I found Imal's I will have found memories.
We had three local dishes that were super delicious! You should definitely try the eggplant dish (brinjal moju)!! The couple which runs this place is also very kind!

Excellent choice - found on TripAdvisor. Right in the middle of Galle Fort, a 2 minute walk from the junction of Pedlar‚Äôs Street and Church Street. Husband and wife team. Great food - the Chicken Kothu was particularly tasty, but everything we had was great....Very reasonable - two main courses, paratha bread, two soft drinks and a large water - ¬£10. TOTAL! This little restaurant is run by an amazing and kind couple.  Their service and food is outstanding.  They are the only people who cook and manage the place. We had Pol roti and Brinjal mojju. I highly recommend both.
Also the puttu and fish Curry...is not to be miss is not to be missed.

Would definitely recommend visiting the Punto Cafe, we both ordered the fish curry, absolutely fantastic, it also came with four very nice side dishes. Great food, very nice people and really good value

Wife and i went in due to previous recommendations. One minute this small place is empty, then once a couple of tables are occupied it seems to encourage others who are walking round in circles around the Fort unable to make a decision.  Due to...the very quick service it can empty again just as quickly. 

Good Khattu. Wanted to have our favourite Sri Lanka dish once more before we left and this was our last night. A little dish of chopped chilli so we could both add to ensure it matched both our tastes.

I loved the kottu and king coconut I had for lunch. Meal was tasty, service was good. Great position inside the Fort.

A cozy small  cafe but still very well decorated and clean. Delicious food and generous portion, friendly staff and very affordable price! I will definitely come back! Thanks for the wonderful Srilanka home made food experience. All the best üå∫
Great little place with huge portions at very affordable prices. We were asked how hot we wanted our food and it was cooked just as asked.

We just had the best Sri Lankan homemade food.

It was so good we had to come back twice, and I wish I had taken a take-a-way bag for some extra.

It is a family run business, and you feel it in the taste of...the food. Very traditional, simple and affordable. I wish I could get a Kotthu dish now.

Thank you for the nice service and great food!

Wonderful curry and rotti! Made fresh and in a kitchen which is fully on display to all customers. We had the dhal plus curry (one chicken and one prawn) plus 2 x rotti, absolutely delicious! We will be coming back again a few times before...we lea we leave.

It can be hard to get the genuine SrI Lankan experience in Galle, like many other ‚Äòhotspots‚Äô across the globe, they tend to be serviced by tourist-only focused restaurants. That all changes with the unassuming Cafe Punto, just outside the main Galle tourist thoroughfare but...still on Peddlar St so central. I‚Äôve been to Galle a number of times and I‚Äôll always come here for the best Kottu Roti in town and to spend time with the most welcoming, humble family within the Fort walls. Tonight we also had the prawn, dahl and paratha which was utterly delicious. A vary tasetefull curry, whith the choice between Spicy and non spicy. Verry generous with the prawns, with nice cool drinks. Also the prices are verry good. Nothing more i could ask for, so 5/5 stars from me, would recommend.

After 2 weeks of experiencing all kinds of wonderful Sri Lankan food at excellent prices around the country, on our penultimate day we treated ourselves to lunch at Aqua Forte. It was a good move!

2 delectable courses later (Carpaccio di funghi / Tomato jelly...caprese to start; Risotto di mare / Ravioli di magro) plus an excellent bottle of Italian Gew√ºrztraminer down, all in a classy and cool setting as respite form the heat, we were ready to brave Galle again in the afterno caprese to start; Risotto di mare / Ravioli di magro) plus an excellent bottle of Italian Gew√ºrztraminer down, all in a classy and cool setting as respite form the heat, we were ready to brave Galle again in the afternoon.

Excellent and original Italian food & wines in an elegant setting with lovely service ‚Ä¶ but at eye-watering prices: the menu is priced in US dollars!  The prices are in fact no higher than you would pay for this quality in London or New York:...but they come as rather a shock in Sri Lanka.  The restaurant is part of a small chain which includes a bakery and pizzeria in Galle and some outlets elsewhere in the count but they come as rather a shock in Sri Lanka.  The restaurant is part of a small chain which includes a bakery and pizzeria in Galle and some outlets elsewhere in the country.

The decor and table arrangements were high quality and there were plenty of staff on hand to cope with the busy custom. 
The quality of the food was amazing and although not huge amounts the flavours made up for this in a big way. A...bit more expensive compared to other local restaurants but this was a special event and well worth the extra we paid. Would definately visit aga bit more expensive compared to other local restaurants but this was a special event and well worth the extra we paid. Would definately visit again.

What a fabulous restaurant. Lovely decor, great service and world class food. We felt a bit guilty about going to an Italian restaurant in SriLanka - but so glad we did. Such a beautifully designed room was a delight to sit in - variations of...white and cream. And the food to as good as anywhere - London, New York, Rome! Just delicious. And a charming team running it. Highly recommend treating yourself to such a great me white and cream. And the food to as good as anywhere - London, New York, Rome! Just delicious. And a charming team running it. Highly recommend treating yourself to such a great meal.

This is a delightful restaurant. The Italian food is as good as anywhere in the world and authentic. The place is simple and elegant. The service friendly and helpful. The prices are a bit higher than other restaurants in the Fort but this is reflected...in everything about the experience. Most especially in the very high calibre and presentation of the fo in everything about the experience. Most especially in the very high calibre and presentation of the food.

Aqua Forte is located inside Galle Fort complex. It is a fine dining Italian place carefully curated interiors. 

However the food left us wanting for more.

Aqua Forte‚Äôs menu is handcrafted and authentic Italian. We went for the 7-course tasting menu, which was unreal. Portion sizes were generous, and the flavor was delicious and complex. Service was friendly and attentive. The setting is romantic and sophisticated, yet relaxed.
Amazing food, service and ambience! Tiramisu is out of this world, the best we ever had!! Owner was with us all the time to ensure we had the best experience. Definitely a must try!

We visited AQUA Forte for dinner to celebrate a birthday, and it really was a special experience. The staff were discrete and attentive, and the setting relaxed and classy. The highlight however was the food! By Sri Lankan standards it is not cheap (mid/high European...prices), but well worth it for the quality and complexity of the dishes. Our favourites were the Caprese starter, the beef strip loin, the passion fruit panna cotta and the tiramisu, but every course was lovely. As Italy lovers, we would like to share our love of Italian food to our Sri Lanka travel guides and to let them taste something different than rice and curry.

Well they loved it. And we did to actually. Excellent Italian restaurant with everything you...would expect. The pastas were just perfect!One little remark: the limoncello could be better would expect. The pastas were just perfect!One little remark: the limoncello could be better :)

We were recommended this restaurant from a friend who loved it here. In the context of the average restaurant‚Äôs in Sri Lanka it is a cut above. The setting is lovely. I loved the vibe, the linen tablecloths. It was clean. I liked that all...the dishes had wine pairings. I thought considering the ingredients and alcohol choices the price was fair. The staff were very attentive, polite and happy to amend things or get us separate pasta dishes for the kids if we so wished. A few things I would like to recommend to elevate the experience and make people want to come back. 
Don‚Äôt just serve oil with bread. Maybe leave a little oil/balsamic on the table. Make sure the bread is fresh baked and not almost stale. Fat on lamb needs to be rendered down. The meat was cooked well but the fat all around was inedible. The chicken dish was well cooked, and tender but was so oily it overpowered the taste of everything else. I felt like a few of the dishes weren‚Äôt ‚Äòcomplete‚Äô dishes. The steak for example, with no carb option. Albeit we added roast potatoes. The passion fruit panna cotta for desert had brilliant flavors. But both the meringue and panna cotta were over done.  I really enjoyed my carpaccio for starter, and my husband enjoyed his escalopes. Overall good. But the execution of the dishes needs fine tun the dishes had wine pairings. I thought considering the ingredients and alcohol choices the price was fair. The food was good and good service, excellent surroundings. Good atmosphere and also for couples an enjoyable place near the fountain.

We had an amazing dinner at the restaurant last night. Tried eggplant for starter and gnocci and chicken for mains. From start to finish it was a flawless experience. The owners, including the head chef, came to our table several times to chat and deliver...our food. The food was authentic and the wine was excellent too. All the servers were friendly and attentive. We hope to return next time we visit Sri Lan our food. The food was authentic and the wine was excellent too. All the servers were friendly and attentive. We hope to return next time we visit Sri Lanka!

We thought it was good value for money . The curries were a bit similar , variety could have been better. We were looking for a Sri Lankan curry with some fresh flavour. It was good but lacked the freshness we had experienced elsewhere.

I was grappling with a moral argument about reviewing this restaurant but decided to do so nonetheless. It is not my intention to belittle a Sri Lankan business, recovering from our economic crisis, but there's a lot of room for improvement. 

First, this review is...mainly for Sri Lankans, not for expatriates. 

First the food:
In a simple word, not meeting expectations and absolutely no spice (as we call it, hotness üòâ) in the food. The number of options, totally inadequate. There's ONLY chicken and no other protein with 4 vegetarian options and only 1 type of rice. 

All this for a whopping Rs. 2,350 per person!!! Absolute & total RIP OFF! I get a far better rice & curry for less than US $ 7 in Colombo with twice the options. 

Location:
Again, a small room squashed inbetween 2 other shops. Sadly, the rent must be astronomical but usually, these locations are family owned. (Most of the time). They don't offer chilled water bottles but the Manager was kind enough to put ice into two cups so that we could have chilled water. The seating is only for 8 people so a very tight squeeze indeed.

Overall:
An absolute tourist trap! Lot like most of the shops inside the Galle Fort. Catering to tourists. I wasn't sure that they were very welcoming of us locals, even though nothing specific was said, but the facial expressions wasn't welcoming. Maybe I was wrong.

I visited this place, purely on the TA reviews and my wife couldn't stop laughing that we paid nearly Rs. 10,000 for just yellow rice & chicken. 

If you're Sri Lankan, avoid this joint! Leave it to the Tourists. They'll think its rustic and enjoy the fo mainly for Sri Lankans, not for expatriates.

Really good and quality food At this local restaurant! And fair prices! I can recomment this restaurant for everyone who visit in Galle.
Sorry but the chicken was over-boiled and dry, the poll sambol was extremely sour . Cannot recommend in good conscience. Service was so-so.

I have spend in Sri Lanka 2 weeks. 
Meal here is my top 3!
Amazing curry taste: pineapple/mango, sweet pumpkin, green vegetables, amazing sambola, chicken and few more! They adding their spices, honey and heart!
Thank you

We are on a Sri Lankan Tour and overnighting in Galle we found this absolute gem on Church Street. Flavour is the watch word of this amazing establishment. It‚Äôs a very simple offering of dishes buffet style with limited seating so my advice is book...or be disappointed. The in house Ginger Beer is top notch and veggie options are well catered for. Don‚Äôt expect to be fawned over by waiting staff but rather get involved and enjoy. 
If there is ever the opportunity to revisit Galle then Coconut Sambol will be sure to featu or be disappointed. The in house Ginger Beer is top notch and veggie options are well catered for. Don‚Äôt expect to be fawned over by waiting staff but rather get involved and enjoy. 
If there is ever the opportunity to revisit Galle then Coconut Sambol will be sure to feature.

All you can eat clay pots that were really delicious. The coconut symbol and the pumpkin dish were my favourites. 2450 rupee, worth every penny. The place was very small and very cute. Not suitable for large crowds, better for a couple or a group...of of 4.

We came here right after watching the sunset. It's all you can eat buffet style. Absolutely delicious food and you get to try so many different dishes. Really friendly service. Oh and the best ginger beer I've had in my life homemade here!
Great food, cute shop, excellent location. Mainly vegan menu with a separate chicken dish. Tasty and fresh ingredients. Welcoming and helpful staff

One of the finest, cleanest, and well priced srilankan food. Very small place, homely cooked food. For 1850 rs est as much as you can from delicious food served in earthen pots. The owner manager was such a warm person. I wish such types of...food outlets flourish over overpriced pretentious large co restaurant food outlets flourish over overpriced pretentious large co restaurants:)

Awesome authentic vegetarian srikankan food . Very humble host and serving the food in clay utensils made food look more authentic . Very tasty n not too spicy food  unlike other srikankan restaurant . They serve only buffet but was very reasonably priced .

Really lovely original Sri Lankan food instead of the normal tourist food in the Fort area.Every dish diffefent with lovely sambals ( chutneys).Ginger beer was delicious,just the right taste to go with the food.
We tried the home made ginger beer ! And trust me when i say ‚Ä¶.. AMAZING ! I loved it allot ! A very good drink after a hot summer day !

We just had dinner at Coconut Sambo after reading reviews of restaurants in the area. We've been in Sri Lanka for 2 weeks and it's the best food we've had so far. Each dish was so different and so delicious. Perfect for vegetarians/vegans as well....Really nice to find this authentic restaurant amongst the more expensive restaurants in the ar Really nice to find this authentic restaurant amongst the more expensive restaurants in the area.

A local gem in a tourist area. They serve a rice and curry all you can eat buffet which is delicious!
Try the ginger beer!
Familial and intimate atmosphere.
Cheap for the area standards.
Very disappointed by the pizzas served at this restaurant- very soggy bottoms with very thick scorched edges . Not good at all ..More
Wonderful pizzas. Nice wide range to suit everyone's particular tastes. The base is lovely. They weren't lying when they said it was authentic pizzas here.  5 stars.

Great pizza so freshly made the base is really nice cooked in a wood fired oven really recommend this place they have a few restraints in Sri Lanka I'm sure they are all lovely would definitely go back .

Arrived later than expected due to taxi not turning up. Never mind as soon as we got into this lovely little restaurant we were greeted warmly! Service was fast and efficient nice waiters. Took our order for drinks within 5 mins. We ordered our food...straight afterwards, 
My husband wanted the burata and had with his caprese  salad instead of the mozzerella, this was no problem. It was delicious and fresh. I had the diavalo pizza with extra mozerella, it came hot large pizza and well cooked slightly charred on the edges which 
I love !! They have an Italian restaurant 3 doors down and waiter informed us he has an Italian chef so will try. It looked very appealing from the outside when we passed and was very busy! Will try another day. If it‚Äôs as good as his pizza then wow. 
Thanks to everyone in Aqua for such a lovely meal and serv straight afterwards,

This restaurant stands up to its rating - Great Pizza ( it is a Pizza only restaurant) Very fresh ingredients. nice staff. Nicely decorated restaurant- Would recommend for Pizza

This is a pizza restaurant, nothing else on the menu, singularly focused and they knock it out of the park! Absolutely perfect Neapolitan style pizzas, fresh toppings, quick service and decent price (for Galle) - totally recommend this place when you want a cheeky break...from curry on your trave from curry on your travels!
Great authentic pizzeria within Galle Fort. Attentive service and pizzas cooked in a wood fired oven. If you want a change from local foods - I highly recommend this restaurant.

Perfectly cooked pizza in an authentic brick oven. 
Not too thin and crispy but just the way I like it. 
A good variety of toppings available. 
Good friendly staff.

We went there spontaneously and what to say: This truly Italian pizza in SL. It is very delicious and brings you to pizza heaven! The prices are higher than in other places in SL but normal for Galle. Highly recommend for everyone who loves pizza...from Ita from Italy!
Excellent pizza! Lovely spot for lunch with one of the best pizzas we have ever had. We went back again it was that good!!

Fabulous pizza! Really tasty and yummy chilli oil to boot. When you just need a break from curry this place has it all! Great atmosphere, nice toilets, good music, nice wine and absolutely gorgeous wood fire pizzas! Yum
It was the best pizza I had in my life. It was so good. The food came really fast and the service Shan made the whole stay very comfortable and very nice. We would recommend that playe for sure!!
Best pizza we ever had! All the ingredients come from Italy! Shan the waiter was very kind and easy going! Really enjoyed eating here!
Delicious pizza straight out of Italy! We were so delightfully surprised. Amazing service with tharindu jayasanka. Thank you

Best pizza from galle!! Really plesant guy was helping us. The service is great and really quick the food is delicious and the restaurant is really clean!

Tharindu jayasanka thanks for the service man SHAKKA OUT

Wonderful colonial house
Very nice ambiance !
Very good food and service 
Definitely to recommend !!!!!
Thank you 
Hope to come another time

Beautiful place with delicious food! 
Hummus with cucumber and bread totally recommend. 

Hope to be back there somedayü§ç

Natan
This was so good! You must go here if you visit. The beef kebab is a must try. Very good service and such a good place to be. Go here
Delicious! This was the best restaurant in Galle. You must go here if you visit. The prawn curry is a must try. Very good service.
It was so so yummy and very good service. Had a delicious prawn curry with lots of rice. I would definitely recommend going again

The best food I have eaten in Sri Lanka. Wrap of chicken with egg and vegetables. 
the Environnement is very good, you can seat outside and you feel you are in LA Habana, Cuba. Waiters are very kind and friendly. Fully recommended

We came across this cafe (and hotel) down little side street.  It was empty so we were dubious.  But it turned out to be a secret gem and very quickly filled up. All 4 of us loved the food, the decor and the friendly staff....Very reasonably priced and relaxed calm, cool atmosphere.   We asked to see the rooms which were beautiful and situated around a pretty courtyard.  10 Very reasonably priced and relaxed calm, cool atmosphere.   We asked to see the rooms which were beautiful and situated around a pretty courtyard.  10/10
Great beautiful place with very good food. Highly recommend. We had tuna and prawns (catch of the day) and both were very good.
Great location with nice lighting and good service. Low occupancy at noon. Great fish and vegetarian options(not on menu but no problem for the kitchen)
Excellent food, good prices, nice area in the fort. Friendly stuff. Can also recommend for Muslims, because the food is halal

The food is tasty! Nice staff and good service !We recomand you this place ! 
Choice of food for everyone. Veggie and not veggie. Nice place

We really enjoyed our time here, we‚Äôve had breakfast and dinner with these guys and they‚Äôve always been welcoming, happy and relaxed. They recommended foods for us, gave us game to play, and the food was absolutely delicious!! I would highly recommend visiting this place...and we will be bac and we will be back!!
Lovely dinner with great service! We had the catch of the day which was the tuna- it was fresh, extremely soft and huge portion. The prawn curry was fantastic with great flavours!

Very nice place with super tasty food! We enjoyed so much :) 
While waiting for food you can play Tic Tac Toe or try to reach the labyrinth
Delicious, well balanced tastes an a calm and classic atmosphere! I would love to try the whole menu! Oldschool furniture is also really nice
Very nice place, good atmosphere! Excellent service, very good food, descent music + sound level. No airco but open air ventilators.
A great place for dinner. The location is lovely and the food was amazing. Upmarket but very relaxed. We had great service from Ismail. Would definitely recommend.

An excellent choice for a romantic meal in Galle Fort. A well considered menu with great service and a very pleasant courtyard setting. 

Food was great and not overly expensive. Fast service.

Great atmosphere in lovely courtyard of a 300 year old building. Our waiter Madushan was very attentive & helped us with our food choices. The tuna steak we both decided on was done perfectly - just seared . Overall an excellent evening with great food...& service inside Galle Fort . Great choice for an evening out in Ga & service inside Galle Fort . Great choice for an evening out in Galle

Great decor, vibe, service, food & cocktails. All in a relaxed holiday feel. You can come dressed up or casual and totally fit in. 
This rivals any major city restaurant in the world so if you are looking for traditional Sri Lankan food or modern...European cuisine then come here. And cocktails are amazi European cuisine then come here. And cocktails are amazing.
We went for a lunch . The food was delicious and there was a friendly staff. The environment was very calm  peaceful  and beautiful

Lovely evening spot with a good atmosphere, best calamari and lovely staff. We had to wait for a table as there are no reservations in this restaurant, but it was certainly worth it. Restaurant manager, Ismail, was extremely kind and attentive offering us menu recommendations...and helped us get a table as quick as possible. We had the calamari, which was the best we have ever h and helped us get a table as quick as possible. We had the calamari, which was the best we have ever had!

It definitely a 5* the courtyard restaurant is cool and open, very stylish, my starter and main where perfect, but the service was excellent!!! On this visit ( as I‚Äôll be back) my waiter was Ismeil , very attentive and friendly..

The Bungalow is brimming with beautiful interior details. Their courtyard & airy restaurant is the perfect place to take a break from the bustling Fort. 

We enjoyed two early evening meals & were seated on arrival. Due to its popularity, the venue can get busy...after sunset. 

Both the food and cocktails were delicious! You can taste how fresh & well prepared the ingredients are. 

Special shoutout to our extremely warm/ attentive waiters Udith & Thimantha. The service was faultle after sunset. 

Both the food and cocktails were delicious! You can taste how fresh & well prepared the ingredients are. 

Special shoutout to our extremely warm/ attentive waiters Udith & Thimantha. The service was faultless!

Great ambience. Good service. Excellent food. The tuna steak was insanely good. 

Ismail is the best waiter. He recommended the tuna! He should get a raise!

Very nice and cosy place to hang out with friends if you're travelling in Galle. 

Good food and a great service received by Zafkar. Would love to come back again in an evening.

Amazing food. I was looking for a place to have less oily food and the rice with the veg curry I ordered was perfect. So was the black amaricano! Thanks Madushan for assisting me and my friends with a well presented tasty lunch the fastest...possible. Definitely gonna visit ag possible. Definitely gonna visit again
Excellent atmosphere, service and food. Truly a hidden gem in Galle fort. The server Madushan was extremely helpful and friendly; had an excellent time here! Recommend for anyone visiting Galle.

The prawn and the veg curry were both fab. Lots of prawns and lots of cashew and veg.
The mango chutney/ pickled mango that comes with the curry also delicious.
The service was lovely- attentive and friendly‚Ä¶. Not overly formal as in some places in...Galle . We were served by Ismail, he provided excellent service. We enjoyed a few cocktails t Galle . We were served by Ismail, he provided excellent service. We enjoyed a few cocktails too.

We have had the best meal so far on our trip in Galle. Lovely place, food was incredible, and the service was brilliant. Would massively recommend as just everything is great! Special thank you to Ismai who looked after us brilliantly, thank you for being...so attentive and friendl so attentive and friendly üòä
